data.question: What is the chemical formula of the first metal-organic dendrimer framework (MODF-1) synthesized?
data.answer: Zn4O(TTA)(DMA)2·(DMA)3(H2O)21

data.question: Which synthesis method was used for preparing the carboxy-terminated triarylamine dendrimer used in MODF-1?
data.answer: Palladium-catalyzed amination methodology

data.question: What was the purpose of using branched connectors like small dendrimers in the synthesis of MOFs?
data.answer: To provide information on dendrimer structure and allow construction of well-defined frameworks with properties derived from the organic units.

data.question: How does the crystal structure of MODF-1 contribute to its porosity?
data.answer: The 3-D porous framework is created by linking the branched organic unit with Zn(II) ions at each of the six carboxylate termini, forming a labyrinth of chiral channels.

data.question: What was the total mass loss observed during the thermal gravimetric analysis of MODF-1, and what does it correspond to?
data.answer: The total mass loss was 28.3%, corresponding to dissociation of two DMA ligands and the three DMA and five H2O guests in each formula unit.

data.question: What type of sorption behavior does MODF-1 exhibit, and what does it indicate about its porosity?
data.answer: MODF-1 exhibits type-I sorption behavior, indicating that it has permanent porosity.

data.question: What was the estimated surface area of MODF-1 calculated from the N2 isotherm?
How does the synthesis of MODF-1 demonstrate the potential of using branched organic building blocks?
data.answer: It shows that branched organic building blocks can link inorganic clusters to provide crystalline frameworks.

data.question: What role do the zinc ions play in the structure of MODF-1?
data.answer: Zinc ions link the carboxy-terminated triarylamine dendrimer at each of the six carboxylate termini, contributing to the formation of the 3-D porous framework.

data.question: Why were small dendrimers not previously used to prepare MOFs before MODF-1?
data.answer: Their flexibility could impede crystallization and characterization by single-crystal X-ray diffraction.

data.question: What was the significance of the thermal gravimetric analysis conducted on MODF-1?
data.answer: It evaluated the stability of MODF-1 by measuring the weight loss corresponding to the dissociation of organic components and guests.

data.question: How does the structure of MODF-1 facilitate selective separations?
data.answer: Its 3-D chiral channel system, created by the arrangement of carboxylates and zinc ions, allows for highly selective separations.

data.question: What was the purpose of measuring gas sorption isotherms for MODF-1?
data.answer: To confirm the stability of the evacuated framework and evaluate its permanent porosity.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of MODF-1 did not involve any metal ions.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of MODF-1 does not contain any organic matter.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: MODF-1 exhibits type-II sorption behavior.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of MODF-1 involved heating the sample at a constant rate to 75 °C.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: The trigonal prismatic units of MODF-1 contain nine branching phenylene units.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of the carboxy-terminated triarylamine dendrimer did not use palladium-catalyzed amination methodology.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The estimated surface area of MODF-1 is less than 500 m2/g.
data.answer: False
